page.title: 16COCKFIELD VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall was built with funds raised by the Cockfield Community Council and a large grant from the Suffolk County Council.It was erected during 1975 to 1976 and opened by the County Education Officer in July 1976. The Hall replaced an old wooden hut.The Hall contains a large hall,a bar,an entrance hall,a committee room,two kitchens(one for school),store rooms and an extension built 5 years later by local builders.The Hall is managed by a Village Hall Committee and the Education Authority.It is heated by an oil-fired boiler that heats water for electric fan heaters and radiators.The clubs and societies that use the Hall are the Women's Institute,the Toddlers' Club,the Community Council,the Mother's Union,the Over 60's and the Youth Club. The Hall is also used for parties, discos,wedding receptions and badminton
